Key Arguments: The proposed legislation is seen as a threat to freedom of speech, which is considered essential for a democratic society.
The bill is perceived as leading towards totalitarianism.
It is argued that the legislation violates Article 19 of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights, which protects freedom of opinion and expression.
Concerns are raised about government overreach and the potential for abuse of power by unelected bureaucrats.
Notable Quotes: Freedom of Speech is the bedrock of a free, open and democratic society, such as we have in Australia.
The proposed bill will interfere with peopleâ€™s ability to receive and impart information through social media.
It is not the role of the government to tell people what they can and cannot say or think.
